intro: Trillium × hagae, commonly known as the hybrid trillium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its three-parted leaves and showy, three-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and thrives in well-drained, acidic soils. Trillium × hagae is known for its slow growth and long lifespan, often living for several decades. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
